---
id: list-ticket-slas
title: "List Ticket SLAs"
description: "Retrieves the SLA definition and accumulated timer metrics for each ticket that matches the supplied GetTicketsRequest filters. The service first runs the same query-engine pipeline as [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) using the $p, $s, and $o query parameters, then resolves SLA data for every TicketId returned on that page. The service overwrites FieldsToReturn with TicketId so the upstream query only fetches identifiers. Prerequisites: (1) Status/workflow filters - Call [GET /api/v1.0/workflows/allproducts/site/{siteId}](/docs/api/workflows/list-site-product-workflows) and reuse WorkflowSteps[].WorkflowStepId/StatusId when building Filters[] entries. (2) Other facet IDs - Use [GET /api/v1.0/tags/query](/docs/api/tags/get-tags-by-query) for tag filters, [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/priorities](/docs/api/tickets/list-ticket-priority-levels) for priority IDs, and [POST /api/v1.0/search](/docs/api/search/global-search) to look up agent/requester UUIDs. (3) Ticket preview - Submit the same body to [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) to verify that the queue returns the expected tickets before requesting SLA information. Workflow Example: (1) Preview queue: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with your desired Filters[] to confirm Items[].TicketId order. (2) Batch SLA lookup: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/slas](/docs/api/tickets/list-ticket-slas) (with $s=50&$o=TicketPriority desc) using the same request body to receive SLA objects for each ticket on that page. (3) Drill down: [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/{ticketId}/sla](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket-sla) to display the detailed timers for a single ticket if needed. Minimal Required Fields: Provide at least one Filters[] facet (status, workflow, agent, ticketId, etc.) or reuse a saved Schema to scope the queue. Leaving the body empty reuses the caller's default ticket view."
sidebar_label: "List Ticket SLAs"
hide_title: true
hide_table_of_contents: true
api: 
sidebar_class_name: "post api-method"
info_path: docs/api/tickets/tickets-api
custom_edit_url: null
---

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"List Ticket SLAs"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/slas"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves the SLA definition and accumulated timer metrics for each ticket that matches the supplied GetTicketsRequest filters. The service first runs the same query-engine pipeline as [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) using the $p, $s, and $o query parameters, then resolves SLA data for every TicketId returned on that page. The service overwrites FieldsToReturn with TicketId so the upstream query only fetches identifiers. Prerequisites: (1) Status/workflow filters - Call [GET /api/v1.0/workflows/allproducts/site/\{siteId\}](/docs/api/workflows/list-site-product-workflows) and reuse WorkflowSteps[].WorkflowStepId/StatusId when building Filters[] entries. (2) Other facet IDs - Use [GET /api/v1.0/tags/query](/docs/api/tags/get-tags-by-query) for tag filters, [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/priorities](/docs/api/tickets/list-ticket-priority-levels) for priority IDs, and [POST /api/v1.0/search](/docs/api/search/global-search) to look up agent/requester UUIDs. (3) Ticket preview - Submit the same body to [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) to verify that the queue returns the expected tickets before requesting SLA information. Workflow Example: (1) Preview queue: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with your desired Filters[] to confirm Items[].TicketId order. (2) Batch SLA lookup: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/slas](/docs/api/tickets/list-ticket-slas) (with $s=50&$o=TicketPriority desc) using the same request body to receive SLA objects for each ticket on that page. (3) Drill down: [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/sla](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket-sla) to display the detailed timers for a single ticket if needed. Minimal Required Fields: Provide at least one Filters[] facet (status, workflow, agent, ticketId, etc.) or reuse a saved Schema to scope the queue. Leaving the body empty reuses the caller's default ticket view.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"$p","in":"query","required":false,"description":"Zero-based page index forwarded to the internal ticket search before SLA hydration.","schema":{"type":"integer","minimum":0},"example":0},{"name":"$s","in":"query","required":false,"description":"Page size (number of tickets) pulled from the queue before resolving SLA data. Defaults to 20 and typically capped at 100.","schema":{"type":"integer","minimum":1},"example":50},{"name":"$o","in":"query","required":false,"description":"Sort expression applied to the ticket list (for example, `TicketPriority desc` or `ModifiedDate asc`). Accepts comma-separated field + direction clauses that match the TicketDetails view.","schema":{"type":"string"},"example":"TicketPriority desc"},{"name":"$d","in":"query","required":false,"description":"Legacy sort direction override used when `$o` only contains the field name. Accepts `asc`, `desc`, `0`, or `1`.","schema":{"type":"string","enum":["asc","desc","0","1"]},"example":"desc"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>
